poem:
In the Time of Unrest

Before dawn, their shadows tangled,
fires flicker in the cobbled streets.
History's heavy breath unsettles
chimney pots and the fragile peace.
In the reflection of shop windows—
young girls' names echo like gospel,
and the song of sirens silences
what heartbeats tried to forget.
